Worth it even if you're late for the party.

Still one of the greatest single game experiences ever.  It was a free add-in to the legendary Orange Box (Half-Life 2) but as a standalone on a Steam Sale it's almost free.  Pick it up, play it, and then play the sequel.  No modern game has captured the feeling of "rat in a maze" better, and no game ever had the level of dry with, humour and originality to boot.  Physics meets Quantum Physics meets sassy dry A.I. This game was and still is perfection.  The cake is a lie.

Portal 2 is a game about a prostitute having a nightmare. I know this because at several points the portal gun tried to make sexual advances on me. 

Despite it's innovative gameplay and improvements over it's predecessor, Portal 2 fails miserably to accomplish it's goal of being a game, instead being an ad-laden experience plagued with Jungle Jim's terrible, terrible food and korean subtitles (if you come to my house and remove either of these I'll give you a spank).

So I didn't even get into the "real game" before the sh*tstorm started. The second you click the "Start le Game" button, your computer will ejaculate, making [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tZF4yRlASX8] this sound [/url] so then you have two messes to deal with.

The controls are broken. The section where you have to navigate the human body a la Magic School Bus was flat out rarted, not because it was a total ripoff, but because you have to use your feet (the game knows). Of course your floating companion, Chris, doesn't make it any better. Chris isn't even special he's just a regular dude in a white t-shirt and jeans who makes inane comments about how underrepresented furries are. He also openly talks about his war crimes, like they just happen every day. Chris is eventually killed off as he is sucked into an enterocyte in the jejunum (thank f*ck).

So once you make it through that garbage your met with something even more vomitous. The final boss, "Big P*ss", is the dumbest finale ever. You leave the sciency place and enter the woods, where a sentient puddle of what can only be peepee starts talking to you about 'Purification' and 'The Harp of Life' and '2Pac Necrophilia Sex Scandal No Clickbait 2019 Read The Description'. After all I fought for I just got more ads, and acne. 

I cannot f*cking believe this game has 'Overwhelmingly Negative' reviews. It's pretty much perfect. I only threw up thrice, and that's pretty much a miracle. Volvo has made the best game ever made and they did it.

I've heard about this game years ago and finally decided to give it a go and I really enjoyed all aspects of it!
Such a well made game with plot twists and hidden easter eggs that keep you interested through out the whole game. 
I love the feeling of "going backstage" and "off the tracks", it gives you a sense that there's this big world outside the game ready to be explored. 
Whilst playing I almost forgot that the game was released in 2007! The graphics don't look that old and I think it's due to the factory environment platforms, it only looks outdated when you see something that's supposed to mimic nature, like liquid that floats and forms in a very unnatural and weird way.

The whole setup is very easy, you get into the controls pretty quickly and learn more as you go. If you are a very inexperienced gamer this game could be a good first experience for you.

And if you haven't played this timeless classic yet I highly suggest that you give it a go.

WHEN'S PORTAL 3!!!
EgyszerÅ±sÃ©ge teszi nagyon izgalmassÃ¡.!

One of valve's best games! Great story, brings back memories.

When I picked up this game in 2015, I wanted to play it and win.

Of course, being the young boy I was, I never did and rage quit after a few chambers.

Here came 2017, and I wanted to try again, feeling a whole lot smarter, and I actually beat the game fairly quickly; therefore, I got Portal 2, and boom shakalaka, I wish, to this day, Portal 3 was a joint everyone could smoke (not that I endorse smoking, although technically I just did) and enjoy.
